{bc}being of comparatively low value and having relatively inferior properties (such as lack of resistance to corrosion)
{bc}containing a larger than usual proportion of base metals

pt: {sc}base{/sc} {sc}low{/sc} {sc}vile{/sc} mean deserving of contempt because of the absence of higher values. {sc}base{/sc} stresses the ignoble and may suggest cruelty, treachery, greed, or grossness.
{sc}low{/sc} may connote crafty cunning, vulgarity, or immorality and regularly implies an outraging of one's sense of decency or propriety.

pt.t: refused to listen to such {it}low{/it} talk

pt: {sc}vile{/sc}, the strongest of these words, tends to suggest disgusting depravity or filth.

et: Middle English {it}bas{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Late Latin {it}bassus{/it} fat, short, low
shortdef: lacking or indicating the lack of higher qualities of mind or spirit : ignoble
being of comparatively low value and having relatively inferior properties (such as lack of resistance to corrosion)
